{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3492468,"name":"antoine schneider","username":"sun167","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/b5e925/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-25T17:52:52.668Z","cooked":"

We’ve had this issue with the 2024 version of YAGSL. When we make our base turn on itself, the modules oppose themselves. In frc web components, it says everything works fine, as you can see in this picture.

The wheels go the right way when we ask it to translate.

In last year’s version, the solution was plugging the gear ratios directly in our Subsystem, as you can see in our post.

This year, this doesn’t work anymore… Can someone help us?

image848×742 27.9 KB

Our code: GitHub - ALPHALAB8067/2025_swerve

Are your angular swerve motors mounted with the drive shaft pointed down at the ground or up towards the sky? If they’re inverted (drive shaft toward the sky), you potentially need to invert the turning direction of your angular motors. This happened to my students a few weeks back.
